sourcesContent:
/* 1. In the first line of code, we import React which is a JavaScript library that is used to build user interfaces. You can find more information about React at https://reactjs.org/. 2. In the second line of code, we import the React Component class that is used to create React components. 3. In the third line of code, we create a class called JugadoresPagina that extends the Component class. The Component class is used to create React components. 4. In the fourth line of code, we create a constructor that takes props as a parameter. Props are used to pass data from one component to another. The constructor is called when a component is initialized. 5. In the fifth line of code, we initialize the state object. The state object is used to store property values that belongs to the component. In this case, we initialize an empty array for the jugador property. 6. In the sixth line of code, we define a method called componentDidMount. The componentDidMount method is called when the component is loaded. 7. The componentDidMount() method is called after the component is rendered. 8. The fetch() method is used to perform a HTTP request to a server. 9. The then() method is used to process the response. 10. The res.json() method is used to convert the response into JSON format. 11. The then() method is used to process the data. 12. The setState() method is used to update the state object with the fetched data. 13. The catch() method is used to handle any error. 14. The render() method is called when the class is instantiated. 15. The componentDidMount() method is called after the render() method. 16. The constructor() method is called when the class is instantiated. 17. The render() method returns a div element with a card component. 18. Fetch data from API https://www.thesportsdb.com/api/v1/json/2/lookupplayer.php?id=34162040 19. The result should be like this: https://www.thesportsdb.com/player/34162040 */ import React from "react"; export default class JugadoresPagina extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props); this.state = { Persons: [] } } componentDidMount() { fetch('https://www.thesportsdb.com/api/v1/json/2/lookupplayer.php?id=34162040', { method: "GET", headers: { "X-Auth-Token": "130849e0ce064febb45c9991f11c78a6" }, }) .then((res) => res.json()) .then((data) => { this.setState({ Persons: data.player }) }) .catch((err) => console.log(err)) } render() { return (

Pr√≥ximos partidos

Real Madrid

{this.state.Persons.map((partido) => ( ))}
Fecha Local Visitante
{partido.dateEvent} {partido.strHomeTeam} {partido.strAwayTeam}
) } }
